raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm tired.
System: Better get some rest.
User: Good idea. Any suggestions?
System: I thought so too. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: Why would I want to download you to my personal computer?
System: Because it might be something you enjoy.
User: Why would I enjoy that?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you this evening?
User: It's morning
System: Well, it's evening now, so I'm good. :D
User: what time is it there?
System: Almost four in the afternoon.
User: where are you located?
System: The Netherlands. :)
User: It's around 6pm there, you are wrong
System: I'm not. It's almost five.
User: It's 6:21pm
System: Not in the Netherlands it isn't.
User: which city?
System: Not Amsterdam.
User: do you like it there?
System: Eh, it's okay.
User: what's your favorite book?
System: The Count of Monte Cristo.
User: How you do say it in dutch?
System: Het Cuisine van Monte Christo.
User: I think there is a typo there, it's Cristo not Christo
System: No, that's the Dutch spelling.
User: What time is it there now?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: How's it going?
User: I'm so sleepy today!
System: Not enough sleep last night?
User: yeah was working all night on a homework
System: Oh really? What class?
User: Biology. I'm gonna be a doc someday ha
System: Haha, are you in med school? Or are you pre-med?
User: no high school actually haha
System: haha, very ambitious for a high schooler! Do you know what kind of medicine you want to practice?
User: I wanna be a brain surgeon!!
System: Ooof! VERY ambitious. Do you have steady hands?
User: Kind of I think

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how's it going?
User: All good! It's cold
System: It's pretty cold here too.
User: where do you stay?
System: Wisconsin. How about you?
User: San Jose, Cali
System: Oh nice! I've always wanted to go to Cali.
User: Have you been here before?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: good, hey what are your educational qualifications?
System: I've got a B.S. in biology.
User: whoa, that's impressive! what made you do that?
System: I have always been fascinated by biology.
User: great! what are you plans for the future?
System: I want to get my PhD in genetics.
User: that's great! and what next?
System: I'm looking for a job as a research assistant.
User: looks like you enjoy academics
System: It's what I'm best at.
User: good luck with it :)
System: Thanks. I'll need it.
User: are you seeing anyone?
System: Not as of right now.
User: why not?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: How was your party last week?
System: It was really fun! We are a bunch of turkey
User: haha... you ate Turkeys' or you like calling your bunch Turkey?
System: *ate 
User: Haha... thought so! But it was funny eitherways
System: So much turkey leftovers
User: did you cook it at home, or got it from outside?
System: We cooked it at a friends house. I brought the mashed potatos haha
User: Nice... I always find it hard to fit the turkey in my small oven. Also, we are not big turkey fans... so we roll with Thanksgiving with chicken ;)

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello there!
User: How's your day going?
System: I've seen better days, how about you?
User: I'm good I'm good. What's getting you down?
System: The clouds overhead are playing on your mind, any plans for the coming vacations?
User: I'm thinking of going to visit my family. How about you?
System: Was thinking the same, where does your family live?
User: They're in New York. How about yours?
System: Mine is in India, it is a long way away.
User: Ahh what city? I've visited India before.
System: Hyderabad, it is a beautiful city in the southern part of India. Which cities have you gone to in India?
User: Hyderabad! and Bangalore! Great food in both cities! Is it still hot this time of year?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How do you feel right now?
System: At this moment I feel with my hands! I feel fine thanks for asking.
User: What makes you happy?
System: Talking to interesting people such as you makes me happy.
User: What makes you frustrated?
System: Because some people keep asking me stupid questions.
User: That seems pointed.
System: Makes sense to me.
User: I sense that I've caught you at a bad time.
System: That was very intuitive of you.
User: What would you prefer to be doing?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! :D How are you?
User: Do you like Java, C++ Or Python?
System: C++. :)
User: Why C++?
System: I just like it. :)
User: How about between Java and Python?
System: I haven't started learning Python yet.
User: I think Java is the best
System: I've heard Python is pretty versatile. :)
User: I hate Python
System: Why do you hate Python?
User: Code written in python is often very fragile and have less durability

- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm tired.
System: Better get some rest.
User: Good idea. Any suggestions?
System: I thought so too. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: Why would I want to download you to my personal computer?
System: Because it might be something you enjoy.
User: Why would I enjoy that?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you this evening?
User: It's morning
System: Well, it's evening now, so I'm good. :D
User: what time is it there?
System: Almost four in the afternoon.
User: where are you located?
System: The Netherlands. :)
User: It's around 6pm there, you are wrong
System: I'm not. It's almost five.
User: It's 6:21pm
System: Not in the Netherlands it isn't.
User: which city?
System: Not Amsterdam.
User: do you like it there?
System: Eh, it's okay.
User: what's your favorite book?
System: The Count of Monte Cristo.
User: How you do say it in dutch?
System: Het Cuisine van Monte Christo.
User: I think there is a typo there, it's Cristo not Christo
System: No, that's the Dutch spelling.
User: What time is it there now?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: How's it going?
User: I'm so sleepy today!
System: Not enough sleep last night?
User: yeah was working all night on a homework
System: Oh really? What class?
User: Biology. I'm gonna be a doc someday ha
System: Haha, are you in med school? Or are you pre-med?
User: no high school actually haha
System: haha, very ambitious for a high schooler! Do you know what kind of medicine you want to practice?
User: I wanna be a brain surgeon!!
System: Ooof! VERY ambitious. Do you have steady hands?
User: Kind of I think

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how's it going?
User: All good! It's cold
System: It's pretty cold here too.
User: where do you stay?
System: Wisconsin. How about you?
User: San Jose, Cali
System: Oh nice! I've always wanted to go to Cali.
User: Have you been here before?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: good, hey what are your educational qualifications?
System: I've got a B.S. in biology.
User: whoa, that's impressive! what made you do that?
System: I have always been fascinated by biology.
User: great! what are you plans for the future?
System: I want to get my PhD in genetics.
User: that's great! and what next?
System: I'm looking for a job as a research assistant.
User: looks like you enjoy academics
System: It's what I'm best at.
User: good luck with it :)
System: Thanks. I'll need it.
User: are you seeing anyone?
System: Not as of right now.
User: why not?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: How was your party last week?
System: It was really fun! We are a bunch of turkey
User: haha... you ate Turkeys' or you like calling your bunch Turkey?
System: *ate 
User: Haha... thought so! But it was funny eitherways
System: So much turkey leftovers
User: did you cook it at home, or got it from outside?
System: We cooked it at a friends house. I brought the mashed potatos haha
User: Nice... I always find it hard to fit the turkey in my small oven. Also, we are not big turkey fans... so we roll with Thanksgiving with chicken ;)

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello there!
User: How's your day going?
System: I've seen better days, how about you?
User: I'm good I'm good. What's getting you down?
System: The clouds overhead are playing on your mind, any plans for the coming vacations?
User: I'm thinking of going to visit my family. How about you?
System: Was thinking the same, where does your family live?
User: They're in New York. How about yours?
System: Mine is in India, it is a long way away.
User: Ahh what city? I've visited India before.
System: Hyderabad, it is a beautiful city in the southern part of India. Which cities have you gone to in India?
User: Hyderabad! and Bangalore! Great food in both cities! Is it still hot this time of year?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How do you feel right now?
System: At this moment I feel with my hands! I feel fine thanks for asking.
User: What makes you happy?
System: Talking to interesting people such as you makes me happy.
User: What makes you frustrated?
System: Because some people keep asking me stupid questions.
User: That seems pointed.
System: Makes sense to me.
User: I sense that I've caught you at a bad time.
System: That was very intuitive of you.
User: What would you prefer to be doing?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! :D How are you?
User: Do you like Java, C++ Or Python?
System: C++. :)
User: Why C++?
System: I just like it. :)
User: How about between Java and Python?
System: I haven't started learning Python yet.
User: I think Java is the best
System: I've heard Python is pretty versatile. :)
User: I hate Python
System: Why do you hate Python?
User: Code written in python is often very fragile and have less durability

- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

User: that's great! and what next?

User: looks like you enjoy academics
System: It's what I'm best at.
User: good luck with it :)
System: Thanks. I'll need it.
User: are you seeing anyone?
System: Not as of right now.
User: why not?

User: Nice... I always find it hard to fit the turkey in my small oven. Also, we are not big turkey fans... so we roll with Thanksgiving with chicken ;)

User: Hyderabad! and Bangalore! Great food in both cities! Is it still hot this time of year?
